chineseMeaning: v. 小口咬 细微之处
examples: He didn't answer, but just continued to nibble at his food.
The mice have nibbled a hole in the cheese.
Food and rent nibbled away at the money they had saved.
She nibbled his ears playfully.
The critic nibbled at the young writer's new novel.
He nibbled at my idea, but would not make a definite decision.
I nipped my finger in the door.
The dog nipped the postman on the leg.
The icy breeze nipped the young blooms.
She wanted to be an actress, but her father soon nipped that idea in the bud.
They never lost a chance to nip at him or steal his possessions.

chineseMeaning: adj. 夜间的 夜间活动的
examples: Stars are a nocturnal sight.
Ali was his principal attendant during this nocturnal survey.
A nocturnal animal hunts its food at night.
The dormouse is a shy, nocturnal creature.

chineseMeaning: 例行公事的,敷衍的 不感兴趣的
examples: The little boy gave his face a perfunctory wash.
He is never serious and works in a perfunctory manner.
The operator answered the phone with a perfunctory greeting.
The periodical is obtainable on the very first day of every month.
She refereed for a periodical a few years ago.
They have already put out a new periodical.
I should be glad if you could insert this article into your periodical.
We dealt with the peripheral aspects of a cost reduction program.
The talks made progress on peripheral issues, but failed to resolve the main dispute between the two sides.
They laughed at my puny efforts at rock-climbing.
Puny though he looked, he was as brave as a lion.
Some doctors are pretty puny characters.

chineseMeaning: 常去的地方 临近的地区

examples: They purvey food for the army.
A duck's quack doesn't echo and no one knows the reason.
She discovered that the man was a quack.
The quack was stormed with questions.
Suddenly the quail hunter threw his net over the remaining quails.
But if you need a right quail, it has to be fleshly or it dries out too easily.

chineseMeaning: v. 放弃主张;撤回;公开宣布;
examples: The man has refused after torture to recant his heresy. 这个人在受折磨后依旧拒绝放弃他的异教信仰。
Those who recidivate are often minor criminals.

chineseMeaning: adj. 鲁莽的;不计后果的;大意的;
examples: He apologized for their reckless behavior.
His brother is a reckless gambler.
It's the way you try to sound rough or reckless.
a sedulous student 一个勤奋地学生
The company dominates this segment of the market.
She cleaned a small segment of the painting.
The waiter brought us a dish of orange segments.
Essentially, each segment is its own address space.
This sub just sets the first line segment up.
The transverse nerves pass to the spiracles of their segment.
a self-absorbed man who seems utterly oblivious to the social problems of his own urban neighborhood 一个超级自私的人,对于街坊的事情完全视而不见

chineseMeaning: n. 感觉,知觉 ;轰动事件
examples: He had a sensation of dizziness.
I knew the train had stopped, but I had the sensation that it was moving backwards.
The new discovery caused a great sensation.
The outrageous book created a sensation.
The anticipation produced in me a sensation somewhat between bliss and fear.
It took all he could do to keep his cart from going over in the tortuous mountain trails.
History follows a tortuous course.
We still have a long and tortuous road to travel.
But the negotiations proved long and tortuous.
He was appointed to superintend the toy department.
The child clutched his toy.
I like the tranquility of night.
Fame and tranquility can never be bedfellows.
The city was finally restored to tranquility.
So that takes more meditations with peace and tranquility.

chineseMeaning: vt. 使变形;改变外观;美化;
adj. 短暂的; 瞬时的
examples: Her feeling of depression was transient.
We stayed at the inn as transient guests.

chineseMeaning: n. 崇拜,敬仰 膜拜
examples: He deserves all the praise and worship.
She scorn the girls who worship football stars.
She was blind to the silent worship in his eyes.
We attended worship this morning.

chineseMeaning: adj. 极差的 沮丧的
examples: She looked wretched and forlorn, despairing of the arrival of a friend who had promised to meet her.
The wretched man lost all his money.
She lamented to us about her wretched lot.
I cannot picture myself in more wretched condition.
The hotel food was absolutely wretched.
The plane is been put off by wretched weather.
It is only the idle that are wretched.

chineseMeaning: 扭曲的 坚持错误的
examples: Gradually a wry smile settled on his face.
He acknowledged his mistake with a wry grimace.
This is a wry comedy about family life.
